entry.def: If a plan or project backfires, it has the opposite result to the one that was intended.

example.tran: 总统的策略可能会适得其反。
一切都与我的愿望背道而驰！

entry.def: When a motor vehicle or its engine backfires, it produces an explosion in the exhaust pipe.

means.word_mean: 1. a loud noise made by the explosion of fuel in the manifold or exhaust of an internal combustion engine
2. a miscalculation that recoils on its maker
1. have an unexpected and undesired effect;

sentences.sentence: "Your comments may backfire and cause you a lot of trouble"

means.word_mean: 2. emit a loud noise as a result of undergoing a backfire;

sentences.sentence: "My old car backfires all the time"

means.word_mean: 3. set a controlled fire to halt an advancing forest to prairie fire

auth_sentence.content: Leverage can backfire on investors if not managed properly.
auth_sentence.res_content: Leverage can backfire on investors if not managed properly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Leverage can backfire on investors if not managed properly.

auth_sentence.content: However, critics say the new rules could backfire.
auth_sentence.res_content: However, critics say the new rules could backfire.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: However, critics say the new rules could backfire.

auth_sentence.content: Some experts worry that the rollout strategy could backfire.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some experts worry that the rollout strategy could backfire.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some experts worry that the rollout strategy could backfire.

means.word_mean: 发生意外, 产生事与愿违的后果

sentences.en: Her schemes backfired on herself,and she lost her boyfriend forever.
sentences.cn: 她的计划害了她自己,从此永远失去了她的男友。

sentences.en: His plan backfired on him, and he lost all his money.
sentences.cn: 他的计划事与愿违, 因此他的钱全亏掉了。

sentences.en: His scheme to win the girl backfired and she went to another guy.
sentences.cn: 他追求那女孩的计划产生了反效果,现在她名花另有主。

sentences.en: The surprise I had planned backfired on me.
sentences.cn: 我设计好的惊喜卻产生了适得其反的后果。
